pageProps.content:
Experience

Situated in the beautiful town of Dullstroom, in the heart of the scenic Panorama Route in South Africa’s Lowveld, you will find Walkerson’s Hotel & Spa.
Set on a 1,500-acre sporting estate close to Dullstroom – a town surrounded by rolling hills & lakes – this country-style hotel is the ideal base from which to explore the region’s activities & attractions.
Dullstroom sits halfway between Johannesburg & the Kruger National Park & provides the perfect overnight stop if you are travelling either way.
The area is known for its excellent fly-fishing & other outdoor activities like hiking, horse riding & picnicking.

Stay

Walkerson’s Hotel features 14 lakeside suites, 11 luxury lakeside suites & 1 honeymoon suite.
Each lakeside suite has a lounge area with a cosy fireplace as well as a patio with gorgeous views over the lake. In addition, the luxury lakeside suites offer both indoor & outdoor bathrooms. Walkerson’s romantic honeymoon suite boasts a fireplace, jacuzzi & private patio with beautiful views over the lake.
Hotel facilities include a sparkling swimming pool, wellness spa, restaurant, cocktail bar & gym.

Activities

Dullstroom is famous for its excellent fly-fishing. Guests can also go on nature walks, go horse-riding or stroll through the streets of Dullstroom with its array of cafés, boutiques & galleries.
Walkerson’s guests can also relax by the swimming pool, work up a sweat at the gym or treat themselves to rejuvenating treatments at the on-site wellness spa.

subfolders.title: Casterbridge Hollow Boutique Hotel
subfolders.description: With an ideal setting in White River, along the scenic Panorama Route, Casterbridge Hollow Boutique Hotel provides an ideal base from which to explore this spectacular self-drive route that leaves travellers from across the globe in awe & wonder. The popular Panorama Route includes the renowned God’s Window look-out point, Blyde River Canyon, the interesting town of Pilgrim’s Rest, Mac Mac Waterfalls & Bourkes Luck Potholes, along with many other scenic stops.

subfolders.title: Oliver's Lodge
subfolders.description: Just around the corner from the world-renowned Kruger National Park, Oliver’s Lodge & Restaurant is an ideal base from which to explore the scenic Panorama Route with its many outdoor activities & attractions. The popular Panorama Route includes the renowned God’s Window look-out point, Blyde River Canyon, the interesting town of Pilgrim’s Rest, Mac Mac Waterfalls & Bourkes Luck Potholes, along with many other scenic stops.

subfolders.title: Perry's Bridge Hollow
subfolders.description: Set in beautiful gardens in a colonial-style shopping village called Perry’s Bridge Trading Post, you will find a country-style hotel that offers an ideal base from which to explore South Africa’s Lowveld region. Perrys’ Bridge Hollow is situated just outside the town of Hazyview & provides a comfortable night’s rest for guests en-route to the world-renowned Kruger National Park.

subfolders.title: Tanamera Lodge
subfolders.description: Tanamera Lodge is nestled on the slopes of the Sabie River valley in Hazyview along the scenic Panorama Route in South Africa’s Lowveld. The popular Panorama Route includes the renowned God’s Window look-out point, Blyde River Canyon, the interesting town of Pilgrim’s Rest, Mac Mac Waterfalls & Bourkes Luck Potholes, along with many other scenic stops.
